WRITING.TEXT: Well, It is possibly one of the best phones for gaming because of the a13 bionic and powerful gpu, so can't technically say it isn't great for gaming... BUT what you can say is that it's battery isn't great.

WRITING.TITLE: Razer Gigantus V2 calibration
WRITING.TEXT: So I recntly bought the Razer Gigabtus v2 medium-sized mouse mat. While I was calibrating my razer deathadder elite, I've noticed that there is no calibrating option for the Gigantus v2 medium. What do you guys think is the closest option for it to substitute?
That uni-body aluminum frame is an absolute tank! I dropped it from 3 feet and still barely any scratches!
Oh wow. I feel embarrassed about my setup just looking at this. Absolutely gorgeous. BUT I think some red lighting on the PC case should improve the looks a bit. Nice pick with the color scheme tho!
Looks awesome
Oh that's weird Didn't notice any problems when buying the software but guess it was because I live in the US
Yeah, I agree. A headset or maybe earphones can improve Zoom call performance in many aspects. But I still did not experience any trouble with my laptop audio and integrated microphone. huh. weird
nice

WRITING.TITLE: Lunar client no sound issue
WRITING.TEXT: So One day I logged into minecraft via Lunar client and boom, no sound. I trued the F3+s command and still nothing good. Can you guys tell me how to fix this issue?
tried\* oof
It was lucky. The impact spread throughout the bottom plate and survived. I am just going to assume it was the aluminum for now. ;)
Exactly there is the iphone 12 mini for those people who want face id and notch with small form factor
Smh he could have done so much better
Ios 14.0.1 will have heating issues and battery loss. Let #8217;s wait for apple to patch with ios 14.1 or 14.2
Hmm ok. Well mine does so maybe mine #8217;s a defect?
awwww

It's best to open up the entire board and add foam on the bottom of the housing, but you can also place the board above a mouse mat or a foamy material to reduce the noise slightly. It varies among different housing materials so this might have significant to no difference.
Wait is he complaining about the stabilizer noise or the board ping?

gt;een's only 720p (technically 750p). You won't see a difference past that. Maybe audio quality? gt; gt;Re Nah it upscales the resolution so more pixels are generated and fitted in the display but because it is not true 4k (displays actually capable of it) you won't get that full crystal clear experience.
Mine has super thin rubber on the bottom that is made to keep your board from sliding around, not exactly for lifting purposes
I realized that there were a bit more ping when used tilted upwards. Thanks for the heads up!

It #8217;s more than enough for me, I use my phone for youtube, reddit, other social media platforms like twitter and instagram, and it lasts just long enough for me to charge before bed. Or so it was. I just recently updated to ios 14.0.1 and battery usage went down significantly. I had to find a cable somewhere in the middle if the day and it is annoying. Hopefully newer ios versions (14.2 or 14.1) will fix this problem. On ios 13, it performs just as I expect it to: more than enough.

WRITING.TITLE: Lubing stabs without desoldering
WRITING.TEXT: Hey. I have a keyboard's stabilizers I want to lube (without desoldering) and can I use super lube's synthetic grease for applying to the sides and the bottoms of the stabs? I don't have dielectric grease and was wondering if synthetic grease will work.
If I had an approximate guess, in about 4 days since that's when the iphone 12 will launch.

It might be because of the stab type. In my board, the rod that connects the two stabs are under the switch itself, making them unaccessible if not desoldered. I heard costar stabs can be pushed out of the frame and pushed back in Easily. that might be why
